repnme.cdata!:
Vietnam - Healthcare Support to the Poor of
            the Northern Upland and Central Highlands Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Health Care Support to
            the Poor of the Northern Uplands and Central Highlands
            Project for Vietnam were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately satisfactory, risk to development outcome was
            substantial, and both the Bank and Grantee performance was
            moderately satisfactory.  Lessons learned include the
            following: (1) It is possible to deliver on needed health
            results to the hard to reach and vulnerable population
            groups with different approaches.  (2) Impact on national
            programs and systems would be enhanced with clear
            expectations and appropriate integration into the health
            administration rather than as a separate project. (3) The
            World Bank administering the funds of another donor should
            be done only when it does not add a double burden of project
            supervision and reporting and provides leverage for greater
            impact. (4) Pilots providing temporary relief to a chronic
            health condition should consider the ethical implications
            and Governments should not exempt such activities from its
            own human experiment review procedures.
